    • start

      public void start() throws ExitProgram, ServerUnavailableException, ProtocolException, java.io.IOException
      Starts a new AbaloneClient by creating a connection, followed by the HELLO handshake as defined in the protocol. After a successful connection and handshake, the view is started. The view asks for

      When errors occur, or when the user terminates a server connection, the user is asked whether a new connection should be made.

      Throws:
      ExitProgram
      ProtocolException
      ServerUnavailableException
      java.io.IOException

    • createConnection

      public void createConnection() throws ExitProgram, java.net.UnknownHostException
      Creates a connection to the server. Requests the IP and port to connect to at the view (TUI).

      The method continues to ask for an IP and port and attempts to connect until a connection is established or until the user indicates to exit the program.

      Throws:
      ExitProgram - if a connection is not established and the user indicates to want to exit the program.
      java.net.UnknownHostException

    • clearConnection

      public void clearConnection()
      Resets the serverSocket and In- and OutputStreams to null.

      Always make sure to close current connections via shutdown() before calling this method!

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage​(java.lang.String msg) throws ServerUnavailableException
      Sends a message to the connected server, followed by a new line. The stream is then flushed.
      Parameters:
      msg - the message to write to the OutputStream.
      Throws:
      ServerUnavailableException - if IO errors occur.

    • readLineFromServer

      public java.lang.String readLineFromServer() throws ServerUnavailableException
      Reads and returns one line from the server.
      Returns:
      the line sent by the server.
      Throws:
      ServerUnavailableException - if IO errors occur.

    • closeConnection

      public void closeConnection()
      Closes the connection by closing the In- and OutputStreams, as well as the serverSocket.
